name: 苏达比·莫拉丹
name_full: 苏达比·莫拉丹 Soudabeh Moradian
introduction: Soudabeh Moradian (Persian:سودابه مرادیان) is an Iranian-American independent filmmaker. A number of her movies have been in official selection of various international film festivals and many of them won awards. She has made many TV documentary series about Iranian rural women, and some independent documentaries about "war and madness" such as "Doomsday Machine"," Story Of The Land On Ashes","Mahin", "Voices Against Them" and some other narrative and documentary films like "The Leader of Caravan","My Name Is Tomorrow" and "Les Chroniques d'iran".The subjects of her movies are mainly based on women, social issues and psychological impacts of war. She made her first narrative feature called Polaris in 2015 in Los Angeles and Seattle starring Bahram Radan, Alicja Bachleda, Elisabeth Röhm and Coby Ryan McLaughlin. She is currently an adjunct faculty at the Art Institute of California - Inland Empire and College of the Canyon - Valencia.
